lines.text: Alarums to the fight, wherein SIR HUMPHREY and WILLIAM STAFFORD are slain. Enter CADE and the rest

lines.speaker: cade
lines.text: They fell before thee like sheep and oxen, and thou behavedst thyself as if thou hadst been in thine own slaughterhouse: therefore thus will I reward thee, the Lent shall be as long again as it is and thou shalt have a licence to kill for a hundred lacking one.

lines.speaker: cade
lines.text: And, to speak truth, thou deservest no less. This monument of the victory will I bear and the bodies shall be dragged at my horse heels till I do come to London, where we will have the mayors sword borne before us.

lines.speaker: dick
lines.text: If we mean to thrive and do good, break open the gaols and let out the prisoners.

lines.speaker: cade
lines.text: Fear not that, I warrant thee. Come, lets march towards London.
